SMASHFLY LAUNCHES FIRST-EVER RECRUITMENT MARKETING CERTIFICATION PROGRAM; 2K  TALENT ACQUISITION PROFESSIONALS ENROLLED

At HiringSolved, our mission is to technologically eliminate all hiring obstructions that prevent recruiters from rapidly matching optimal talent to crucial roles. We are witnessing a world where people don’t write their resume—they live it. In essence, people write their resume little-by-little every day. It happens when they check into a location, have public conversations, share open source projects, post pictures, and more. Reaping the fruits of this enormous ecosystem requires intelligent learning software. This astronomical task cannot be solved with a singular job board, browser extension, ATS, or search engine. Developing real solutions means boldly breaking the archaic mold and proceeding with a novel philosophy. We aim to fundamentally change the way people are hired forever. Ultimately, we endeavor to solve hiring.

Talent acquisition has evolved wIth the rapid rise of machine learning and artificial intelligence. This one-day recruiting conference will focus on the skills practitioners need to know to excel as a talent acqusition professional today and in the future. Expect tactical takeaways you can implement immediately and strategic insights to help you guide your organization in the right direction in the future. Register now for our February event in NYC https://hireconf.ticketleap.com/hireconf/

SourceCon originally began as an idea to develop an educational conference uniquely dedicated to internet and telephone researchers, sourcers, sourcing leaders, and those interested in learning more about the art and science of recruitment sourcing. The SourceCon website was launched after the very first SourceCon conference in 2007 and has been a destination site for information, knowledge, and news for the sourcing community ever since. In the summer of 2009, SourceCon was purchased by ERE Media and the tradition continues. What is sourcing? In 2007, most sourcers created lists of candidates and recruiters made the phone calls. Today, the primary problem for most organizations has changed. Building lists has become easier but getting a candidate to answer their phone or respond to an email has become difficult. Because of this, we now define sourcing as identifying and engaging talent.

Oversaw the activities of a team of Candidate Engagement Specialists and Researchers (up to 24 people) responsible for the strategic and tactical sourcing plans to identify and engage potential candidates for current and future Honeywell positions.● Collaborated with Randstad Sourceright Sourcing Center of Excellence (COE) to develop, implement and track strategic and tactical sourcing approaches and effectiveness across  the Honeywell enterprise● Worked closely with Recruiting Managers and Operations Director to understand forecasted and immediate hiring demands and develops a sourcing structure and approach that exceeded offer accept goals and reduced time-to-fill and req aging metrics● Provided knowledge, guidance and training on advanced sourcing tools and techniques to the Honeywell recruiting and sourcing teams● Worked with Operations team to measure and report productivity of sourcing channels to meet demand and engage top talent ● Reported sourcing productivity and effectiveness metrics weekly to senior staffing leadership within Honeywell and Randstad● Managed requisitions and pipeline development for internal RSR / Honeywell recruiting and recruiting manager positionsJeremy Roberts: Social Media Branding, Talent Acquisition, Avature CRM, Sourcing Metrics, RPO, Recruitment Process Outsourcing

Space and Airborne Systems is a leading provider of sensor systems giving military forces the most accurate and timely actionable information available for the network-centric battlefield. With 2009 revenues of $4.6 billion and 12,000 employees, SAS is headquartered in El Segundo, Calif. Besides Goleta, other facilities are in Forest, Miss.; Dallas, McKinney and Plano, Texas; and several international locations.Started as a Full-cycle corporate recruiter of professionals including Program Managers, Systems Engineers, Architects, Analysts, Cryptologists, Radar Engineers, Supply Chain Management, Security, Contracts, Business Area Chief Engineers, Program Area Chief Engineers, and Engineering Staff.After 14 months with Raytheon, I assisted with the creation of a sourcing function. Responsibilities Included:● Responsible for developing a comprehensive talent community within designated niche or functional specialty. The objective of this proactive work is to develop a bench-strength of ready now talent for customer needs. Responsible for nurturing proactive network of talent for immediate access/submission to open requisitions, or for proactive exploratory searches. ● Act as a search expert for functional area(s) by understanding functional hiring needs, position specifications, and search requirements.● Train Talent Acquisition Partners on sourcing best practices.●  Worked with 5 person team to establish a Service Level Agreement for HR Business Partners, Hiring Managers, and Talent Acquisition Business Partners which was implemented within Raytheon Space and Airborne Systems.● Support the Raytheon Talent Acquisition team social media strategy by contributing to the Rayteon Careers Facebook page and the @Raytheon_Jobs twitter account.✔ Completed a Raytheon 6 Sigma Specialist project focusing on the implementation of Avature CRM as the Space and Airborne Systems Sourcing CRM.

summary: I've worked in third party executive search, recruitment process outsourcing (RPO), and  corporate talent acquisition. Currently I help talent acquisition practitioners leverage machine learning and artificial intelligence to save time identifying and engaging candidates. NOTABLE SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS•	SourceCon Spring 2017 Keynote - How to Survive the Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence Disruption •	SourceCon - Keynoted and Emceed 6 SourceCon events during my 3 year tenure as SourceCon Editor (2013-2016)•	DFW Staffing Management Association - Advanced Sourcing Strategies - 2015•	ERE Expo; Spring 2014 Talent Communities, Pools, and Networks: Lessons Learned•	SourceCon Spring 2014 - Emcee and Leader of Google+ Sourcing Lab•	Staffing Industry Analysts Executive Forum 2014 - Panelist•	SourceCon Fall 2013 - The State of Sourcing in 2013•	ERE Fall 2013 - Establishing a Strategic Sourcing Program•	Drivethru HR | Featured Guest for online radio show•	DFWTRN | "Boolean Basics for Recruiting"•	DFWTRN | Google+ for Sourcers and Recruiters•	Talentnet Live Conference at JC Penney | "Cool Tools" Workshop•	Talentnet Live Conference at Pepsico | Candidate Closing Workshop •	DFW Staffing Management Association | Sourcing Talent IS Rocket Science – Creating a   Strategic Sourcing Program
